Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> All that truly matters, is the funds are unspendable when the blockchain analyst "attacker" wants to analyze

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you spend the funds in 5 years, the attacker would then need to re-run the analysis and then would maybe get your data.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> obviously, nation states will just automate this stuff and record all zcash protocol chains, like they do the internet itself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> think of the privacy your future self might want

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <actionslacks> I have a feeling the xmr attack could be demonstrated and published far and wide and it wouldn't affect the price at all.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> in secp256k1, the all 0 privkey and all 0 pubkey are illegal field elements, so it cant be spent

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> not 100% sure how the zaddr privkey works, but would be surprised if all 0s pubkey has a corresponding spendable privkey

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> so using  ITM's method of analysis every priv coin (ZEC, XMR, GRIN) can be de-anon'd, even HUSH and ARRR until they introduce the coin burn technique to prevent linkage?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> ARRR is currently immune to amount analysis, but with the planned atomic swap function, it needs to mitigate this attack first

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> all other coins leak massive amounts of data with having taddrs all over the place

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> it is like trying to maintain privacy in a crowd, where everybody has their cellphone cameras recording. even if you are not broadcasting, the context gives you away

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Great analogy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh this technique will work on every coin that uses Bitcoin Protocol, Zcash Protocol or CryptoNote protocol (xmr forks). Not sure about GRIN

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c I thought of some mitigations that Hush can do, some sneaky things, to prevent the ITM attack. Can't drop them all publicly, but good ideas are flowing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c 0sat burns are viable, as long as the zutxos are made unspendable. That makes me feel better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That means it's relatively "free" to protect against the ITM attack, if you are willing to spend time on it, and txfees

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM you started a whole thing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> i dont see how reverse proofing wont work with any utxo based system

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> the way it works is "invalidating" a specific utxo and then seeing what utxo also become invalid

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yes, all UTXO-based coins are vulnerable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ETH people are real happy right now (they don't use UTXOs)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> so blockchain that uses a chain of spending, seems vulnerable to the ITM attack

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> but balance based has no privacy at all...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yeah, it was a joke üòâ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c so, 0sat burning is viable for Pirate and Hush, and it's basically a free protection, that only costs txfees. zaddr coins can protect themselves from the ITM attack, but without taking action, they are very vulnerable. XMR forks seem to be in a rough situation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> i am not 100% sure 0 sats burns will work. depends on zcash internals, maybe there are special cases for clearly unspendable outputs like that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> but 1 sat should be good and that will not be any real issue. just think the fiat cost of 1 HUSH sat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> would anybody really have any issues paying that for the privacy?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c i would pay many sats for privacy, but if 0sat burns work exactly as well, those are more efficient for exchanges and mining pools doing many xtns. It cuts into their profitability

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c what is your concern about 0sat burns?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 0sat burns are almost like the Sapling Woodchipper

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so I have seen some interesting things that zcash internals do with massive amounts of amount=0 zutxos

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it brings out bugs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> my concern with 0 sat burns is that it might not mitigate the ITM attack

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The important thing, is to make the chain end

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You cannot do linkability analysis past the end of a chain of xtns

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's the unspendability that is important

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we could make them worth 42 HUSH each, it would still break the attack. or 42sat, or 77.7 HUSH

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 0sat will work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it takes some work, it's not easy or free @jl777c

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the current internals will do dumb stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but we can make things smarter

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's possible to spend an amount=0 zutxo, yes it is!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's just a zutxo to the wallet, it has no idea amount=0 is special

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BUT

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> They are only spent when sending amount=0 zutxos, and we can do special precautions about these zutxos. I will not say more at this time üòé

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> with XMR, RingCT and lot transactions in a single ring uses lot resources. Because XMR has tiny transactions per RingCT. For XMR to be safe, they need to enforce a minimum amount of transaction per block and it be near impossible with RingCT. But looking at XMR, most blocks are just 2 to 3 transactions which is really easy. If XMR enforces like 20 transactions per block minimum + use the previous block fake transaction hash, they be extremely secure with there approach + they will need to match the computation power of the network to reverse it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> since the previous fake transaction hash made will mess up my approach.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> with 20 transaction per block for XMR = 20! x 12 x tiny transaction count + previous block hash transaction. Which will screw any analytics on XMR. XMR privacy cannot then be broken with today computing power.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Biz> What impact do you think stealth addresses would have on this method?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Biz> I.e. one time addresses derived from a base address, in XMR

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Biz> Not all public keys match 1:1 with a basic address. Many are stealth addresses (one-or-many-use keys)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> So XMR the miner can fill the block with small fake transactions to increase the transaction count.
